3. Kindly scroll down for older posts before asking . Best source is the Pasig Public Information Office FB page (verified account).

While we try to answer questions, checking if it's already been answered will save us all time.

Thank you and Have a blessed Easter weekend!

Vaccination reminders

1. NO WALK-INS. Delikado kung dadagsain natin ang venue.

2. Let's be patient. The vacc team will do its best but keep in mind the limited supplies. Eg. we have ~80K seniors, but only 3K doses of Astrazeneca on hand (Sinovac not yet recommended for seniors)

@sunshinegray No need for now. It may take some time. Please also bear in mind that we have around 80,000 seniors but as of now have only ~3,000 Astrazeneca doses available. (Sinovac not yet recommended for seniors)

Thank you for your understanding!

What's important is that seniors update their profile https://t.co/nlvCt9YFxG 

If you've updated with our profiler (via call/ in person), NO NEED to visit this link.

We only have around 3000 doses of Astrazeneca on hand. As per DOH guidelines, Sinovac not yet for seniors

Reminder for our vaccination program: NO WALK-INS.

Crowd control is always the biggest challenge.

Pls wait for a profiler to contact you. We will do our best with the limited supplies available. Thank you for your cooperation!

1,400 seniors will be vaccinated on Monday.

@objectionsdesk Kung testing dahil kayo ay close contact, 14-day quarantine ang sabi ng DOH, counting from date of exposure. Kami dapat ang magtetest sa inyo kung close contact ka at hindi private lab.

Alinsunod sa IATF Resolution para sa paghihigpit sa Greater Manila Area hanggang April 4 (Pasko ng Pagkabuhay), iiwasan pa rin natin ang face-to-face meetings hanggang April 5.

I said "IF YOU CAN stay at home" ..this is directed at people who may want to go out for fun or unimportant things.

Key points:
Travel - for work: allowed.
Travel - for vacations: NOT allowed.
Transportation - no change.
Restaurants - delivery allowed 24hrs; outdoor only for dine-in.
Eating in workplace - bawal magkatabi/magkagarap.

Wearing masks at home when interacting w elderly encouraged.

In response to the currently over 80,000 active cases in the Philippines, the national IATF has issued Resolution No. 104 (March 20, 2021).

1. Revising our protocols given new information about covid-19 (some are subject to DOH approval);

1.1. e.g. adjustments to our Centralized Quarantine Facility, considering the different variants. Separate building/rooms used for cases of a variant;

In light of the recent SURGE of cases in the region and the emergence of VARIANTS in the country, let us remain vigilant and compliant with all health protocols. Wag maging kampante. Marami pa tayong hindi alam, lalo na tungkol sa mga dumarating na variant.

[7of7] Establish a mechanism for citizens to propose city ordinances & policies.

(Will discuss this more at another time. A tweet-explanation is bound to get misinterpreted.)

No 1 person can claim to know all the answers. Let's unlock the collective brilliance of the Pasigue√±o!

[5of7] Form sectoral councils

Such as a Transport Council, Market Council, and Environment Council.

Each will have NGO/CSO representatives, public sector reps, and experts.

Any proposed policy must 1st pass thru the respective council before City Council approval;

[3of7] Monitoring of NGO/CSO reps in public bidding and service delivery.

This should prevent/minimize corruption to a degree, but more than that, it will help make procurement more efficient.

#Transparency #Accountability

[2of7] Full implementation of the
Transparency/#FOI Ordinance.

How can people participate w/o good information? Process must also be clear, with an online platform for searches and requests.

The Full Disclosure Policy is a good step toward transparency, but is not enough.

Why is this important for our city?

1. We should give our workers - especially long time employees - security of tenure and proper benefits.

2. We need to isolate the bureaucracy from politics. An employee shouldn't have to be worried about non-renewal for political reasons.

The lack of qualified applicants is NOT a good excuse.

There are many available low-level positions that do not require civil service eligibility. There are also a number of special laws that give employees eligibility.

I raised the question of why Pasig has so many vacancies in our plantilla.

According to the proponent Coun. Rupisan, there are over 1,000 vacancies.

Yet the LGU employs thousands of casual & JO employees. I talked to an Admin Aide (utility) who has been contractual for 16 years

The main difference between this proposed ordinance and the existing FOI EO (other than it covers LGU) is that most ~interesting~ documents will be made public even if no 1 asks.

This will prevent situations where some anomalies stay hidden forever because no 1 knows they exist

This morning, I filed my proposed Pasig Transparency Ordinance with our Sanggunian. The law has 2 main parts:

1. Automatic online publication of documents, including bidding & awards(!!!)
2. Availability of all public records upon request
